medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Patient presents with a 5-day history of constant right-sided abdominal pain that radiates to the back, shoulder, and hip. Symptoms began 2 weeks ago with significant fatigue that prevented her from going to work. Five days ago, she experienced nonbloody, nonbilious vomiting with virtually no oral tolerance. She also reports chills but denies fever, along with intermittent constipation and loose stools attributed to IBS.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Hypertension, GERD, Irritable bowel syndrome, Hyperlipidemia.
